thread.title: Man wanted by police bears uncanny resemblance to Beaker from The Muppets - Mirror Online
thread.title_full: Man wanted by police bears uncanny resemblance to Beaker from The Muppets - Mirror Online

author: Steve Robson
title: Man wanted by police bears uncanny resemblance to Beaker from The Muppets - Mirror Online
text:
Man wanted by police bears uncanny resemblance to Beaker from The Muppets Lewis Maxwell, 30, is sought for allegedly breaching a court order Share Lewis Maxwell, 30 (Photo: WALES NEWS SERVICE) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A man wanted by police has been mocked online after his mugshot was compared to a character from The Muppets. 
Jokers have likened Lewis Maxwell's features, including slim head and wild hair, to Beaker, the shy assistant to Dr Honeydew from the popular children's show. 
Gwent Police in South Wales issued an appeal for help finding Maxwell, 30, for allegedly breaching a court order. 
But the post was quickly taken over by comedians having a laugh at his unkempt curly haircut and bleary-eyed appearance. 
Maxwell was also compared him to The Simpson's character Sideshow Bob - known in the long-running cartoon series for his desire to kill Bart. 
One post said: "Last seen in Springfield." The character 'Sideshow Bob' from The Simpsons (Photo: FOX) 
Another man wrote: "Ain't that the guy that tried to kill Bart?" 
And one more said: "Last seen on The Simpsons, he's mates with Krusty the clown, think his alias is Bob." 
Maxwell also came in for a bit of stick for apparently looking older than his 30 years. 
One person wrote: "30, wow, he's had a tough life." 
Another added: "He must of have had a hard paper round." 
A spokeswoman for Gwent Police said: "We are appealing to help locate 30-year-old Lewis Maxwell from Newport. 
"Officers would like to speak to him following a breach of a court order. 
"Anyone with information about his whereabouts should call Gwent Police." Like us on Facebook
